intro: Barleria harnieri, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Barleria harnieri is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
